title-group.article-title: Superior Idle Elimination System for Truck Air-conditioning (SIESTA)

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2004 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: This no-idle climate control (NICC) system designed for heavy commercial and military vehicles (class 8 line haulers) will decrease emissions, cost, and fuel usage without sacrificing crew comfort. The system is designed for the sleeper cabin of the commercial trucks and crew compartment of the military trucks. During the night, truck drivers tend to idle the engine in order to provide heating or cooling while they sleep. This system will provide that comfort at approximately 13% of the fuel usage. Military personnel will also benefit by the ability to supply heating or cooling to the crew compartment during silent watch operations. This quiet solution to crew comfort along with the reduction in pollution and energy consumption will position this NICC system for commercial success.
